lines.text:
[Escorting Mrs. Hall down the stairs]
I've never been in a position quite like that before.
I remember you!
And I remember you too. Now get out of my store and stay out!
Oh, don't be like that. Let bygones be bygones. Let's help each other. You have a business, and we have a business. We'll send people to your store, and you send people to our store. What do you say?
You mind your business and I'll mind my business. Now get out before I throw you out!
It has been ruthlessly dragged through the mud and mire. Never let it be said that a Hardy's spotless reputation to be so maliciously tread upon.
You're right, Ollie; he who filters your good name steals trash.
You wanna get us arrested before the customers arrive?
What time will they be here?
Well they'll be here about..."what time will they be here?" Why, customers come at any time!
[Oliver is on the windowsill on the second story of a store]
What are you doing up there?
I'm waiting for a streetcar.
Where are you going?
Tit for tat.
What?
Tit for tat.
[Stan tips his hat]
What's that for?
I thought you said, "Tip me hat".

[breaks up a fight between Stan, Ollie and Charlie]
Just a minute. Don't you think this thing has gone far enough? Who started this anyway?

[he and Stan point to Charlie]
He did.
I did not.
Why he did too. Why this little upstart, in the presence of my friend, slandered my character, for which I demanded an apology. He refused to give it, hence this petty little argument.
Slandered your character?
Yes, sir. He filtered his good name, didn't he?
Filtered his good name?
Why you know what he did? He accused me of a clandestine meeting with his wife.
[Mae gasps]
For which I was wholly, and absolutely, innocent.
Then what were you doing coming downstairs with my wife?
Oh, what nonsense. There was nothing to it.
Nothing to it, Officer. He was waiting for a street car...

[to Charlie]
Well it looks like you're to blame. You better apologize to this gentleman.
I will not.
Oh yes you will, or I'll run you in.
Well, alright. But don't let it happen again.

[They shake hands]
No hard feelings.
